CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 22, 1955, page 10, reads: "Cotillion Leaders - AKA sorors have selected two outstanding citizens to officiate at the fourth annual Debutante Cotillion, Feb. 11, at the Gateway Plaza. Gracious Mrs. Homer S. Brown, president of the National Girl Friends, Inc., and wife of Judge Brown, will present the debs, while Attorney and Councilman Paul F. Jones will serve as master of ceremonies. All honor guests were entertained at a social hour last Friday night at Ammon Recreation Center, marking the beginning of rehearsals for the Cotillion. Information concerning invitations can be had by calling Mrs. Geri Reynolds, 2800 Centre Avenue. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Paul F. Jones and Wilhelmina Byrd Brown holding document, standing in Ammon Recreation Center
